trans-unit.source: Failures on Serial Number Tracked Items

seg-source.mrk: Failures on Serial Number Tracked Items

trans-unit.source: Items that use serial number tracking must be assigned to the proper serial numbers to be credited. The serial numbers for failures can be selected from active serial numbers (shipped, not returned).

seg-source.mrk: Items that use serial number tracking must be assigned to the proper serial numbers to be credited.
The serial numbers for failures can be selected from active serial numbers (shipped, not returned).

trans-unit.source: Failures are processed the same way for serial numbers as without, meaning based on whether the failure is within or outside of the invoicing period. The only difference is how the serial number is added to the failure.

seg-source.mrk: Failures are processed the same way for serial numbers as without, meaning based on whether the failure is within or outside of the invoicing period.
The only difference is how the serial number is added to the failure.

trans-unit.source: Exercise – Failures with Serial Numbers within the Invoicing Period

seg-source.mrk: Exercise – Failures with Serial Numbers within the Invoicing Period

trans-unit.source: Customer R-20000 orders three trucks (item R-20000-01, serial numbers NTGS35-00001 – NTGS35-00003) for the period of January 1, 2019 through March 31, 2019 at a price of 1375.00 each. This is a monthly invoicing agreement; however the customer has asked to be invoiced for January and February immediately.

seg-source.mrk: Customer R-20000 orders three trucks (item R-20000-01, serial numbers NTGS35-00001 – NTGS35-00003) for the period of January 1, 2019 through March 31, 2019 at a price of 1375.00 each.
This is a monthly invoicing agreement; however the customer has asked to be invoiced for January and February immediately.

trans-unit.source: On March 27th, the customer calls to say that one of the trucks has stopped running (NTGS35-00002). They will return it on March 31st and they do not want to be billed for the remainder of the contract for this truck.

seg-source.mrk: On March 27th, the customer calls to say that one of the trucks has stopped running (NTGS35-00002).
They will return it on March 31st and they do not want to be billed for the remainder of the contract for this truck.

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to create the rent order:

trans-unit.source: Insert a new rent order for customer R-20000.

seg-source.mrk: Insert a new rent order for customer R-20000.

trans-unit.source:
Expand the Rental FastTab and enter the following:
  1. Rental Rate Code = Month
  2. Rental Start Date = 01/01/19
  3. Rental End Date = 03/31/19
  4. Month Based = Yes

seg-source.mrk: Expand the Rental FastTab and enter the following:
• Rental Rate Code = Month
• Rental Start Date = 01/01/19
• Rental End Date = 03/31/19
• Month Based = Yes

trans-unit.source:
On the first line of the Lines FastTab, enter the following:
  1. Type = Item
  2. No. = R-20000-01
  3. Quantity = 3
  4. Rate Unit Price = 1375.00 (and add values if missing on Rate Component lines)

seg-source.mrk: On the first line of the Lines FastTab, enter the following:

• Quantity = 3
• Rate Unit Price = 1375.00 (and add values if missing on Rate Component lines)

trans-unit.source:
Open the invoice and notice the following:
  • A negative credit line for the failed unit from 03/27/19 – 03/31/19 appears on the invoice.
  • The credit is correctly calculated for the damaged unit (1375 rate unit price / 31 days * 5 days = 221.77).

trans-unit.source: Exercise – Failures with Serial Numbers before the Invoicing Period

seg-source.mrk: Exercise – Failures with Serial Numbers before the Invoicing Period

trans-unit.source: Customer R-20000 orders two trucks (item R-20000-01, serial numbers NTGS35-00001 – NTGS35-00002) for the period of January 1, 2019 through March 31, 2019 at a price of 1375 each. This is a monthly invoicing agreement and the January invoice is posted immediately.

seg-source.mrk: Customer R-20000 orders two trucks (item R-20000-01, serial numbers NTGS35-00001 – NTGS35-00002) for the period of January 1, 2019 through March 31, 2019 at a price of 1375 each.
This is a monthly invoicing agreement and the January invoice is posted immediately.

trans-unit.source: In mid-January, the customer calls to say that one of the trucks is not running properly (NTGS35-00002). You remember that there was a repairable issue with this truck so you assure them that it can be fixed at no cost for the down period of January 15th through January 16th and tell them that they will receive a credit memo with the next invoice billing.

seg-source.mrk: In mid-January, the customer calls to say that one of the trucks is not running properly (NTGS35-00002).

You remember that there was a repairable issue with this truck so you assure them that it can be fixed at no cost for the down period of January 15th through January 16th and tell them that they will receive a credit memo with the next invoice billing.
